titleStmt.title: George Keeser to James F. Robinson
CWG8843

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his excellency James F Robinson Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky. Your petitioner George Keeser states that at the last April Term of the Boyd Circuit Court he was fined the sum of $60 -- on the charge of Keeping a tipling House in Boyd County -- Your petitioner was not informed that there would be a court for the trial of causes at said Term, he in consequence did not attend. he says he is satisfied he had a valid defense if he had presented the same, he knows that he is not Guilty. he say the judgement was rendered by default on his part -- he is poor -- he ask your excellency to remit the penalty or fine assessed --

I James W. Riley clerk of the Boyd Circuit Court do certify that in the prosecution above describe a that Judgement was rendered against George Keeser without his making defense to the same & was not presant -- this May 2nd 1863 & that George Keeser is worthy of credit as to statements made by him
Jas M Riley C B C C
We the undersign ask your excellency to remit the fine of $60 -- rendered gainst himGeorge Keeser at the April Term 1863 of the Boyd circuit court -- we think it is right=

James W Riely
Thos E Henderson
Wm Ely
J. G. Sawntain
Wm Cox
N A Brown
G, W, Brown
Owen Adkins
John Fauconer
R Waterman
James Seaton
Richard Scott
John B. Wellman
Jas.D. Jones
R Eastham
W A Foster
Jas S Wise
L T Moore
H Savis
C S McConnell
J. C Burks
John D Murphy
Thos Q Ewing
John H Ford.

The foregoing petition is signed by the best citizens of Boyd County -- including L. T. Moore who was judge that set at the April term last of the Boyd circuit court in absence of R Apperson Sr the judge Moore presided in cause of Keeser -- C L McConnel Presiding judge of the Boyd County Court -- J D Jones County attorney J W Riley clerk of the County & circuit court --

George Keeser
to } Petition for release of Fine
Gov Jas F Robinson
Boyd Cir. Ct
Fine remitted except Ten dollars & costs
J F Robinson
$60 } Tipling
Issd May 14th 1863
